value.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was trained by [PAWN_possessive] guild in infiltration and espionage. [PAWN_pronoun] learned to keep a cool head and to talk [PAWN_possessive] way out of tight situations. When talking didn't work, [PAWN_pronoun] was capable of more violent direct action.

During the wars, [PAWN_possessive] parents were captured and [PAWN_pronoun] was born into a life of slavery. Forced to clean coliseums after bloody battles for money. Watching, waiting, and learning. Coliseums were the only thing [PAWN_pronoun] ever knew.
One night while cleaning the coliseum, [PAWN_possessive] family was murdered.

Born on a kingdom wracked by plague, both of [PAWN_nameDef]'s parents were doctors.
[PAWN_pronoun] experienced little social interaction. However, [PAWN_pronoun] gained a lot of medical experience assisting in treatments.

[PAWN_nameDef] provided medical care on multiple plague-wracked villages, always working under the Hippocratic oath. [PAWN_pronoun] improved conditions for those under quarantine while administering complex medical treatments and developing medicines.
[PAWN_pronoun] never had time to enjoy a normal life outside of work.
[PAWN_nameDef] worked as a bartender in a seedy tavern. The job was one part drink-serving, one part diplomacy, and one part head-bashing.

[PAWN_nameDef] grew up helping in [PAWN_possessive] father's smithy. They were some of the last smiths on the region that to use traditional smithing methods. They even collect some materials themselves.
Sometimes, after work, [PAWN_nameDef] would practice using the swords [PAWN_pronoun] forged.

Born to a long line of mercenaries, [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a busy trading hub.
At a young age, [PAWN_pronoun] was recruited into one of the mercenary bands.

After refusing the wild demands of a tyrannical king, [PAWN_nameDef]'s nomad band was marked as an outlaw group and systematically hunted.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef]'s family was eventually captured. Those who weren't killed were taken as slaves. Sold to the owner of a smithy, [PAWN_nameDef] swore that one day [PAWN_pronoun] would have [PAWN_possessive] revenge.

As a child, [PAWN_nameDef] was addicted to reading. [PAWN_pronoun] would spend all day in a library with [PAWN_possessive] nose in a book. When the library was burned down in an accident, [PAWN_nameDef] was distraught. [PAWN_pronoun] decided to fill the gap by writing [PAWN_possessive] own stories instead.
[PAWN_nameDef] was educated in the liberal arts and taught at a local school. [PAWN_pronoun] was widely knowledgeable and well-liked by [PAWN_possessive] students.
On [PAWN_possessive] homeland, [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a moderately successful inventor. [PAWN_pronoun] developed several apparatus.
